{"step_by_step_thinking": "AFP stands for Acute Flaccid Paralysis, and it is a clinical syndrome characterized by rapid onset of weakness, including (in severe cases) breathing and swallowing, progressing to maximum severity within several days to weeks. It is a key indicator in polio surveillance. The World Health Organization (WHO) has set a standard for AFP surveillance, which is at least one case of non-polio AFP per year per 100,000 population under 15 years of age. This is to ensure that no cases of polio are missed.", "answer_choice": "D. At least one case of non-polio AFP per year per 100000 population of under 15 years"}
